org.naomi.regex

Class BackReferencePattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.naomi.regex.Pattern
      • org.naomi.regex.BackReferencePattern
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlterationListener

    public class BackReferencePattern
extends Pattern
    An instance of this Pattern matches the same string matched by some previously matched Pattern (specified by the referent argument of the BackReferencePattern Constructor).

    Example: 

        Pattern vowel=new ExplicitCharClass("aeiou");
    Pattern back=new BackReferencePattern(vowel);
    Pattern doubleVowel=new ConcatenatePattern(vowel,back);
    Here, doubleVowel matches (for example) "ee" and "ii" but not "ei".

      Thrown when a BackReferencePattern has an inappropriate referent.

      • copy

        public BackReferencePattern copy()
        Description copied from class: Pattern
        Copy this Pattern.
        Specified by:
        copy in class Pattern
        Returns:
        A Pattern identical to this Pattern AT THE TIME OF INVOCATION. Except that cached data will not be preserved, as if Pattern.altered() were invoked. Normally calls Pattern.copyTo(org.naomi.regex.Pattern).
